cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest tonight, then turning north-northeast on Wednesday, tracking toward the southeast Louisiana coast and then accelerating inland across Mississippi and Alabama
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Buras/Grand Isle – roughly the LA/MS border area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch west of Morgan City LA to Intracoastal City LA (not including Pascagoula)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City LA eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border; Storm-Surge Warning from Mouth of the Atchafalaya River LA eastward to Navarre FL including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (forecast 3–5 ft with 5–8 ft just west of port)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) beginning Wednesday afternoon with a chance of hurricane-force gusts Wednesday evening/night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground possible along the Mississippi coast, including Pascagoula Bay; higher 5–8 ft values just west toward the Pearl River
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated totals up to 6 inches producing flash/urban flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Risk of a few tornadoes Wednesday and Wednesday night
